Viewing Hive Properties

Sometimes you may want to review the properties of a specific hive or change its settings. For example, you may want to move its Archives or Cache folder to an alternate location. In that situation, you must use the Hive Manager, which is available from the Server Administration dialog. From this dialog, you can change the properties of a server that is running.

Changing the Archives path for a hive is generally done because of a serious problem, such as a drive failure. It must also be done with caution, or the results can be unexpected. New paths will not take effect until the server has restarted. See the StarTeam Administrator's Guide for more information.

Note: You can perform this function only on servers that are currently running.

To view hive properties and change their settings:

  1. On a computer that has the Server installed, select Start > Programs > StarTeam > StarTeam Server x.x > StarTeam Server. The Server Administration dialog appears. It allows you to change the properties of only those servers that are running.

  2. Select a server configuration. If you have not logged on already, you will be asked to do so.

  3. From the Server Administration dialog, do one of the following:

    • Click the Hive Manager shortcut in the lower left panel.

    • From the menu, select Tools > Administration > Hive Manager.

      • These actions display the Hive Manager dialog, which shows all the hives currently created for the selected server configuration.

  4. Select the hive that you want to view.

  5. Click Properties. This action displays the Hive Properties dialog, which shows the following information about the hive:

    • Name

    • Archive path

    • Cache path

    • Maximum cache size

    • Cache cleanup interval

    • Storage limit threshold

    All of these fields, except Name, are editable. For the default and possible settings for Maximum cache size, Cache cleanup interval, and Storage limit threshold, see Creating a New Hive.

  6. Select or deselect Allow new archives. The default is selected. Since a server configuration must have at least one active hive, you cannot clear this check box for all hives or if only one hive exists.

  7. (Optional) If you are using StarTeamMPX, set a Root Cache Agent archive path.

  8. Click OK to confirm your choices and return to the Hive Manager.  The changes (except to the path) will immediately be made in hive-index.xml. The path changes will take effect only after the server re-starts.

  9. Click Close.

    10.
